availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Archibald Hunter (Lyon County, Kentucky, master saddler)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, master saddler. Kentucky native. Married to Caroline Liggin Hunter. Father of Martha A. B. Hunter Bowman and James H. Hunter. Married to Mary A. Hunter. Saddler in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Master saddler in Lyon County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Lyon County in 1860. Employed Alfred E. Robb as a saddler and Cilenira E. Robb as a servant in Lyon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 328A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 885.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 768-9.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 416A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 42B-43A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 16643.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Lyon County Administrators Bonds, 1889-1951, p. 45.
"A Hunter (1812-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 135667522, accessed November 18, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135667522.
